title: Fixes issue #88 (empty frame panic).
body: Should be enough to fix #88 .

title: Add `Frame::map_data`
util: Update docs
body: Updates some util's docs.

title: util: Fix futures-util allowed version range.
body:
This should potentially be a stricter range, since futures-util doesn't follow semver, but I'm leaving this at the most permissive thing that doesn't currently result in broken builds, since I don't know this project's stance on dependency versioning.

Fixes: #83

title: docs(http-body): Update Body docs to reference new poll_frame method
body: Fixes #78

title: Change return type of Frame::into_* methods from Option<T> to Result<T, Self>
body:
This new return type allows for a more ergonomic type conversion experience than the current "check-and-unwrap` flow the current return type encourages.

Fixes #77

title: util: update Cargo.toml to use published RC1
http-body-util: fix Collect if a poll is not ready immediately
body: I noticed in some hyper tests if the body wasn't available immediately, some data was being lost. Eventually noticed it's because the buf list wasn't persisted between polls 🙃

title: chore: Prepare `1.0.0-rc1` release of `http-body`
body: cc @seanmonstar

title: http-body-util: allow Collect even when not Unpin
util: Add a `Collected` body and combinator
body:
- Add a new `Collected` body that buffers all DATA frames and the trailers and provides ways to convert those DATA frames into `Bytes` and `impl Buf`. These replace hyper's `aggregate/to_bytes` free fns.
- Add a new `BodyExt::colect` combinator to create a buffered body from another `impl Body`.

Related to https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/3010

title: Body trait forwards-compat redesign
body:
This implements the core of the proposal in https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/2840. The `Body` trait is now a stream of `Frame`s. The `Frame` type can be extended in a forwards-compatible way with new types, while also allowing access to "unknown" types. The purpose is so that code upgrading will not suddenly stop working because the `kind` changed.

There's some questions in here that could use some bike-shedding. Besides that, there's some optional pieces that we could figure out now, or could punt to after getting the first RC out.

- [ ] Creating an "unknown" frame
- [ ] Accessing the bytes of an "unknown" frame
- [ ] The `Buffered` type with more specific awaitable combinators (`data()`, `trailers()`) besides just `frame()`
- [ ] A `frame_match!` macro in util to ease matching

title: util: Add `Either` util
body:
This PR introduces a new type, `Either`, as discussed in #59.

`Either` implements:
* ~~`std::error::Error`~~
* ~~`bytes::Buf`~~
* `http_body::Body`
* ~~`From<Result<L, R>>`~~

`Either` also provides some methods like: ~~`flip()`, `map_left()`, `map_right()`, `map()`, `either()`, `as_ref()`,~~ `into_inner()`.

Due to the limitations of `pin-project-lite` this PR does not use the `pin_project!` macro but instead uses a slightly adjusted expanded version.

This change is entirely backward compatible.

title: Add `StreamBody`
body: Adds `StreamBody` which creates a `Body` from `Stream`.

title: chore: Prepare `0.4.5` release
body:
# 0.4.5 (May 20, 2022)

- Add `String` impl for `Body`.
- Add `Limited` body implementation.

title: feat: add `Limited` body
body: This should be compared to the implementation in #60.

title: Add String impl for body
body:
Closes #57

This PR adds a `impl Body for String` to allow users to provide more ergonomic APIs that can support simple use case like passing a string. This PR does not add support for `&str` or `Cow<'a, str>` since neither of these pass an owned and thus mutable "buffer" view that can be used to track if we've returned the data in `poll_data` already.

cc @nmoutschen

title: Move adapters to `http-body-util`
body:
Move utilities and combinators to a separate package

Hyper works with all combinators removed, as would anything that depends on the initial 0.4 release.

Removing methods from the trait is a breaking change, but it is possible to do the semver trick (release 0.5, then release 0.4.x with a dependency on the 0.5 trait) to not split the ecosystem and make the change painless.

Addresses #52.

title: Add `UnsyncBoxBody` combinator
body: cc @hawkw

title: Add proper `Debug` impl for mapping combinators
body: Previously `#[derive(Debug)]` was used on the mapping structures. The structures consist of the original body and mapping fn, and since it's impossible to implement `Debug` for `Fn`, mapping structure were effectively never `Debug`.

title: Implement `Default` for `BoxBody`
body:
This makes `BoxBody` usable with [`RequireAuthorization`] which requires `ResBody: Default`.

[`RequireAuthorization`]: https://docs.rs/tower-http/0.1.1/tower_http/auth/struct.RequireAuthorization.html

title: v0.4.2
body:
# 0.4.2 (May 8, 2021)

- Correctly override `Body::size_hint` and `Body::is_end_stream` for `Empty`.
- Add `Full` which is a body that consists of a single chunk.

title: Correctly override `size_hint` and `is_end_stream` for `Empty`
body: I noticed this while working on https://github.com/hyperium/tonic/pull/622 as it broke some interop tests.

title: Add `Full`
body:
This implements a part of hyperium/hyper#2345.

This implements `Clone` and, for example, a client can clone it to retry requests (e.g. for [redirections][tower-http-79]).

[tower-http-79]: https://github.com/tower-rs/tower-http/pull/79

title: v0.4.1
body:
Includes:

> - Add combinators to `Body`:
>   - `map_data`: Change the `Data` chunks produced by the body.
>   - `map_err`: Change the `Error`s produced by the body.
>   - `boxed`: Convert the `Body` into a boxed trait object.
> - Add `Empty`.

title: Add `Empty`
body:
`Empty` is a little utility type that I have found useful in a few
scenarios. For example to make a "catch all" `tower::Service` that
always returns `404 Not Found` with an empty body.

title: Add body combinators
body:
Adds `BodyExt` with the following methods

- `map_data`
- `map_err`
- `boxed`
- ~~`into_stream`~~

Disabled by default and can be enabled with the "util" feature.

EDIT: These methods are now added directly on `Body`.

Fixes https://github.com/hyperium/http-body/issues/34

title: Allow publishing again
body: Woops.
